text: Alessandro Strozzi (died 28 August 1648) was a Roman Catholic prelate who served as Bishop of San Miniato (1632–1648) (in Latin) and Bishop of Andria (1626–1632). (in Latin) ==Biography== On 4 May 1626, Alessandro Strozzi was appointed during the papacy of Pope Urban VIII as Bishop of Andria. On 8 March 1632, he was appointed during the papacy of Pope Urban VIII as Bishop of San Miniato. He served as Bishop of San Miniato until his death on 28 August 1648. == References == ==External links and additional sources== * (for Chronology of Bishops) * (for Chronology of Bishops) * (for Chronology of Bishops) * (for Chronology of Bishops) Category:17th-century Roman Catholic bishops Category:Bishops appointed by Pope Urban VIII Category:1648 deaths
title: Alessandro Strozzi (bishop of San Miniato)
